channel.title: photography on KevOps
channel.description: Recent content in photography on KevOps

item.title: Fujifilm X30
item.description: A picture of my Fujifilm X30, taken with an iPhone in low light and not edited. I kinda liked the result. Right now the Fujifilm X30 is my main camera which I try to carry with me at all times. It’s a great camera for quick snapshots and day-to-day photography. I’m thinking about getting another camera with switchable lenses, but I cannot decide on one. It’ll probably be either a Fujifilm X-T2 or Canon EOS 5D Mark 2 - right now I have a strong preference for the Fujifilm.

item.title: Merl
item.description: Shortly after snapping this image the Merl had enough of me starring at it and flew off.

item.title: Foggy City
item.description: The city in thick fog, seen from my kitchen window.

item.title: Saint Elizabeth's Church Wiesbaden
item.description: One of the sightseeing spots in Wiesbaden is St. Elizabeths Church, a orthodox church located on top the Neroberg. I’m looking forward to taking some better photos of it in the future.

item.title: Sunny Morning Rainbow
item.description: Just a quick shot from my window. Enjoy your day! :)

item.title: Foggy Forest
item.description: A foggy view of a foggy forrest, taken from my balcony with my old Canon 1000D and Sigma 18-200mm F3,5-6,3.

item.title: Fasanerie
item.description: “Fasanerie” is the name of a local wildlife and forest park. It’s free to enter and a very nice place to spent a family day. All images were edited with Darktable, a free open source Adobe Lightroom alternative.

item.title: City Walk Wiesbaden
item.description: Some pictures I took while walking through the city of Wiesbaden. All images in this post were taken with my Fujifilm X30 camera.

item.title: Imbiss
item.description: Neon sign at night, taken during some festivities in Mainz, Germany.

item.title: Roadhouse
item.description: On my way to Berlin I snapped this image of a roadhouse at night.

item.title: Mond
item.description: A picture of the moon I took from my window when I was younger.

item.title: Pau
item.description: I spent one month in France working in a IT shop in Pau as part of my school education. I don’t speak a word french so this was quite fun and challenging.

item.title: Colza Field
item.description: Walking through the fields of a small town is always a good idea, you never know what you’ll find.
